columns.name: display_name
columns.description: The name displayed in the address book for the user. This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial and last name.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the group.

columns.name: description
columns.description: An optional description for the group.

columns.name: classification
columns.description: Describes a classification for the group (such as low, medium or high business impact).

columns.name: created_date_time
columns.description: The time at which the group was created.

columns.name: expiration_date_time
columns.description: Timestamp of when the group is set to expire.

columns.name: is_assignable_to_role
columns.description: Indicates whether this group can be assigned to an Azure Active Directory role or not.

columns.name: is_subscribed_by_mail
columns.description: Indicates whether the signed-in user is subscribed to receive email conversations. Default value is true.

columns.name: mail
columns.description: The SMTP address for the group, for example, \"serviceadmins@contoso.onmicrosoft.com\".

columns.name: mail_enabled
columns.description: Specifies whether the group is mail-enabled.

columns.name: mail_nickname
columns.description: The mail alias for the user.

columns.name: membership_rule
columns.description: The mail alias for the group, unique in the organization.

columns.name: membership_rule_processing_state
columns.description: Indicates whether the dynamic membership processing is on or paused. Possible values are On or Paused.

columns.name: on_premises_domain_name
columns.description: Contains the on-premises Domain name synchronized from the on-premises directory.

columns.name: on_premises_last_sync_date_time
columns.description: Indicates the last time at which the group was synced with the on-premises directory.

columns.name: on_premises_net_bios_name
columns.description: Contains the on-premises NetBiosName synchronized from the on-premises directory.

columns.name: on_premises_sam_account_name
columns.description: Contains the on-premises SAM account name synchronized from the on-premises directory.

columns.name: on_premises_security_identifier
columns.description: Contains the on-premises security identifier (SID) for the group that was synchronized from on-premises to the cloud.

columns.name: on_premises_sync_enabled
columns.description: True if this group is synced from an on-premises directory; false if this group was originally synced from an on-premises directory but is no longer synced; null if this object has never been synced from an on-premises directory (default).

columns.name: renewed_date_time
columns.description: Timestamp of when the group was last renewed. This cannot be modified directly and is only updated via the renew service action.

columns.name: security_enabled
columns.description: Specifies whether the group is a security group.

columns.name: security_identifier
columns.description: Security identifier of the group, used in Windows scenarios.

columns.name: visibility
columns.description: Specifies the group join policy and group content visibility for groups. Possible values are: Private, Public, or Hiddenmembership.

columns.name: assigned_labels
columns.description: The list of sensitivity label pairs (label ID, label name) associated with a Microsoft 365 group.

columns.name: group_types
columns.description: Specifies the group type and its membership. If the collection contains Unified, the group is a Microsoft 365 group; otherwise, it's either a security group or distribution group. For details, see [groups overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/groups-overview?view=graph-rest-1.0).

columns.name: member_ids
columns.description: Id of Users and groups that are members of this group.

columns.name: owner_ids
columns.description: Id od the owners of the group. The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object.

columns.name: proxy_addresses
columns.description: Email addresses for the group that direct to the same group mailbox. For example: [\"SMTP: bob@contoso.com\", \"smtp: bob@sales.contoso.com\"]. The any operator is required to filter expressions on multi-valued properties.

columns.name: resource_behavior_options
columns.description: Specifies the group behaviors that can be set for a Microsoft 365 group during creation. Possible values are AllowOnlyMembersToPost, HideGroupInOutlook, SubscribeNewGroupMembers, WelcomeEmailDisabled.

columns.name: resource_provisioning_options
columns.description: Specifies the group resources that are provisioned as part of Microsoft 365 group creation, that are not normally part of default group creation. Possible value is Team.

columns.name: nested_groups
columns.description: Members which are group.

columns.name: tags
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTags

columns.name: title
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTitle

columns.name: tenant_id
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTenant

columns.name: metadata
columns.description: Metadata of the Azure resource

columns.name: og_account_id
columns.description: The Platform Account ID in which the resource is located.

columns.name: og_resource_id
columns.description: The unique ID of the resource in opengovernance.
